author: tersec

author: johnydony
content:
Hello guys. 
```
INFO [03-13|06:12:15.873] Legacy sync reached merge threshold      number=25871 hash=71b5cc..98411e td=1,000,280,299,023 ttd=1,000,000,000,000
INFO [03-13|06:12:15.985] Legacy sync reached merge threshold      number=25871 hash=71b5cc..98411e td=1,000,280,299,023 ttd=1,000,000,000,000
INFO [03-13|06:12:16.185] Legacy sync reached merge threshold      number=25871 hash=71b5cc..98411e td=1,000,280,299,023 ttd=1,000,000,000,000
```
Geth is stuck block height 25871( it's prysm-geth).

author: parithosh
content: You seem to still be using the old TTD, you need to look at these docs and update your TTD: https://hackmd.io/DhdBFJLKR822lRjrrQw0lA?both

author: johnydony
content: Old block data has to be removed? EL &. CL both of them?

author: parithosh
content: Uhhh I think it should work without removing the data. But I'm not sure since your node is already in an unhealthy state. Maybe a clean setup would be the easiest.

author: pk910
content: what's the current TD? and when is the merge expected to happen in kiln?

author: parithosh
content: Current TD is ~53% of TTD. We are trying to plan the merge for wednesday.

author: johnydony
content: <@!199561711278227457> Even if TTD reached, Geth has to be working isn't it?

author: parithosh
content: Yes, Geth and the other ELs will still need to be online after the merge. They would help produce blocks + continue to store state + expose the JSON RPC interface and so on. Its just that the mining aspect will cease to work.

author: johnydony
content: Thank you for the kind explain üôè

author: parithosh
content:
Here's a backup faucet in case anyone is having issues with the main faucet: https://faucet.kiln.ethdevops.io/
We'd prefer not to advertise it widely, hopefully the bots won't find it easily?

author: tdelabro
content:
Hey I followed this tutorial: https://github.com/remyroy/ethstaker/blob/main/merge-devnet.md
I did the last part, about becoming a validator, and what I get is this:
```
Mar 14 15:57:04.001 CRIT Failed to spawn sync contribution tasks, error: Error fetching duties for slot 22160, service: sync_committee
Mar 14 15:57:04.001 WARN Missing duties for subscription         slot: 22160, service: sync_committee
Mar 14 15:57:06.000 INFO Connected to beacon node(s)             synced: 1, available: 1, total: 1, service: notifier
Mar 14 15:57:06.000 INFO Awaiting activation                     slot: 22160, epoch: 692, validators: 1, service: notifier
```
Is there something I should do, or should I just wait a bit ?

author: seamonkey82
content: Those CRIT and WARN messages will go away once your validator is active.  It's a bug.
